data.title: Vietnam War
data.meta_description: The National Archives has a wealth of records and information documenting the U.S. experience in the Vietnam conflict. These include photographs, textual and electronic records, audiovisual recordings, exhibits, educational resources, articles, blog posts, lectures, and events.    What's Happening? Learn about our current programs and exhibits related to the Vietnam War.
data.text:
The National Archives has a wealth of records and information documenting the U.S. experience in the Vietnam conflict. These include photographs, textual and electronic records, audiovisual recordings, exhibits, educational resources, articles, blog posts, lectures, and events.

Vietnam War Topics

Explore more records, information, articles and resources at the National Archives organized by subject area.

Vietnam War Timeline

Journey through events with select records from the National Archives Catalog.

Most Popular Vietnam-Era Records

Marine Corps Command Chronologies for the Vietnam War

Office of Civil Operations and Rural Support (CORDS)

Vietnam War Casualty Records, through Access to Archival Databases (AAD)

State Lists of U. S. Fatal Casualties of the Vietnam War

Navy Deck Logs Available in the National Archives Catalog

Records Relating to American Prisoners of War and Missing in Action from the Vietnam War Era, 1960-1994, a Finding Aid to Records

Record Group 472: U.S. Forces in Southeast Asia

The Pentagon Papers

Citizen Archivist

Help make records more discoverable by tagging and transcribing in the National Archives Catalog. Learn more on the Citizen Archivist Dashboard

More Resources

Discover more Vietnam War resources from the National Archives, or contact us to plan a research visit.
